description: The Community Based Training Scheme in Karnataka provides training in various vocational courses for women to promote self-employment and employability. It targets rural and urban women to enhance their economic independence.
key_features: Free vocational training in multiple trades

benefits.stipend: Monthly stipend during training, up to Rs. 1,000

residency_criteria: Must be a resident of Karnataka
economic_criteria: Preference for women from low-income households

eligible_activities: Training in trades like tailoring, computer skills, or beauty services

steps: Obtain the application form from the District Women and Child Development Office
Submit the application with proof of eligibility
Attach required documents, including Aadhaar and residency proof
Applications are reviewed by the department
Selected candidates are enrolled in training programs
application_process.note: Applicants must commit to completing the training program

special_notes: Training is conducted at community centers
Priority is given to women from rural areas
